name: SpringHill Suites Flagstaff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in February on our way back from Grand Canyon. We needed to wash our clothes badly and it was really nice to be able to get complimentary laundry detergent and dryer sheets. The room was clean. Like some other reviewers stated, you might hear some noise from the hallway, or other rooms although we didn't think it was at a level that was troublesome for us to sleep. Breakfast was typical of this type hotel with various hot and cold items. I was happy with my stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel with good amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Feb 2012 for 1 night. The room is nice with a comfortable bed. Fairly standard for hotels around this price range.
reviews.title: Nice room but very noisy

reviews.text: The pool is ok and a it has a decent fitness centre for a hotel of this size.
reviews.title: Rooms were alright...

reviews.text: 1 bad factor was the noise from the corridoor. there is absolutely no sound insulation from your room to the corridoor. We were unlucky in that we had drunken neighbours in the rooms in our corridoor but even after that quitened down there was still a lot of noise from people walking past etc.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Breakfast Not So Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could the owners maybe splash out on solid doors that prevent noise instead of pintless dcor?
reviews.title: Such a pleasant surprise!

reviews.text: Overall this hotel was perfect for our needs. Flat screen tv, free Wi-Fi and large desk, microwave, refrigerator, separate living room, free breakfast... etc. The list goes on! I felt this was a good hotel for the money we spent... I do kind of feel like some of the upgrades were on the cheaper side of modern (example: IKEA) but I really have no complaints. Oh, and they provided us with a military discount which is rare nowadays to be recognized as service member.
reviews.title: Modern Decor With Spacious Guest Rooms

reviews.text: It looks all new inside. Very mondern. Breakfast was good but alittle crowded and we had to wait for plates and certain food items never replaced during our stop for breaky...ie eggs. Otherwise overall good spot to spend the night
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I were driving out to California, and decided to
reviews.title: Reminiscing inFlagstaff

reviews.text: spend a few days in Flagstaff. We love this area, and decided to
reviews.title: Great location, fabulous accommodation

reviews.text: check into Spring Hill Suites.
reviews.title: Nice, clean pet friendly hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here multiple nights over the holidays. Arrived very late the first night and noticed there were some maintenance issues that needed to be addressed. We gave the list of issues to the front desk first thing in the morning and they were very responsive. Told us we could move to another room as soon as one nearby was cleaned as they would have to tear some things apart in our room (sink faucet). When we moved to our next room, we noticed a new shower curtain had been hung and the housekeeping manager apologized for the moving hassle. If someone in housekeeping had reported the obvious issues in the first room, it would have been helpful. We proceeded to have a very comfortable stay. The fitness room was nice and adequate for our needs. The breakfast was satisfactory and the usual fare of eggs, muffins, oatmeal, sausage, cereals, etc. It was very crowded every morning but each day they opened an overflow room in a meeting room to accomodate the large crowd (hotel was sold out many nights).
reviews.title: We would stay here again

reviews.text: The beds were a little too firm and there is a definite shortage of drawer space. We used the closet shelf to store our dirty laundry. I liked the look of the sliding frosted glass door but maybe not so practical since the room is lit up once a light is turned on in the bathroom. We returned late several evenings but always found parking around back. Room doors shut quietly which is a big plus to me. We lost power in our room one morning and maintenance was there very fast. Reset a breaker and we were quickly back in business. Another example of the responsiveness of this staff which we appreciated very much.
reviews.title: did not accomodate reservation request

reviews.text: I made a reservation on 8/7/11 for adjourning rooms and one was to have a pack'n play or crib too accommodate my 2 yr old granddaughter. Upon arrival on 12/17 I was informed that no cribs were available because persons who previously checked had first choice along with a platinum card holder.
reviews.title: Recent stay/kids to play in snow

reviews.text: Therefore they consider a request just that and not a guarantee, Nor did we have adjourning rooms. My granddaughter slept with her mother and proceeded to fall out bed 3 times and cut her ear. Had we be informed on confirmation that there was a possibility that a crib might not be available we could have brought our own.
reviews.title: Nice rooms for a great price.

reviews.text: We had been looking forward to our trip to the Polar Express and our overnight stay and instead the hotel stay was a disaster
reviews.title: Best Marriott chain!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August when visiting the area with my family. We were visiting the Grand Canyon and Sedona, and chose Flagstaff as our home base. For a mid-range hotel, we were very surprised by how enjoyable our stay here was. It had received a lot of mixed reviews, but for what it is, I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: The SpringHill Suites is nothing fancy or overly upgraded, but serves really well for tourists on the go. It’s not far off of the highway, and in similar fashion to most interstate exits, is clustered with a bunch of other chain hotels, restaurants, and gas stations. It is basically just across the road from NAU as well. The hotel is pretty non-descript from the outside, a typical 4-story chain hotel. It looks like the hotel was built a while ago from the exterior, but everything inside was fresh and updated. The hotel is kind of crammed into the lot it’s built on, so parking wasn’t overly plentiful. However, we never had trouble getting a spot right in the front.
reviews.title: Perfect Location - Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived to the hotel late at night after a long day at the Grand Canyon. We were checked in quickly and hoped to get right into our room and go to bed. Unfortunately, the first room we were assigned did not work out. It had an odd smell. I thought it just smelled a bit musty, but my mom insisted she smelled smoke (despite it being a smoke-free hotel). Regardless, we didn’t think we could handle the room with the smell, so we called down to the front desk to switch rooms. The front desk staff was very apologetic, and when I went down to get keys to another room, everything was ready. The employee immediately recognized me, handed me new keys he had prepared, and 10 seconds later, I was back in the elevator. I really appreciated this, since it was late at night and we just wanted to get into bed quickly. In addition, it was nice that they were able to move us into a room only two or three doors down from the first one, so relocating was no big deal. The second room was much better.
reviews.title: Worth the trip.

reviews.text: A lot of people have complained about the design of the rooms here, but I really didn’t have too much of a problem with them. Yes, they aren’t true “suites”, but that’s simply what SpringHill Suites offers. They have slightly larger than average hotel rooms with an open living area in addition to the beds. The living area has a nice L-shaped couch and desk, while the beds are closer to the window. The bathroom is directly off of the bed section of the room. Everything in the room and bathroom was fresh and new, in the hotel’s modern blue motif.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE service - stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just reiterating what others have said, some things about the room design are odd. The TV isn’t really in a good position to be viewed from either the beds or the living area. It is odd that the closet is inside the bathroom, rather than accessible from the rest of the room. Most annoying, though, is the bathroom door. The sliding bathroom door is frosted glass. It isn’t see-through, but does let significant light from the bathroom through. This is a definite problem if others in the room are trying to sleep while one person is in the bathroom, since the bathroom door is right at the foot of the beds. The towels and bath products were also somewhat lacking. I can easily overlook these imperfections though. Everything was quite clean, and in great condition. The room was larger than the average hotel room, which we found quite comfortable.
reviews.title: Bright and Modern - what a great change!

description: Conveniently located at the crossroads of I-17 and I-40, the hotel is steps away from many restaurants and shopping areas. Relax around the swimming pool or soak up the magnificent views of the San Francisco Peaks. Whether traveling on business or pleasure our hotel is just minutes away from local restaurants, shopping and historic downtown Flagstaff.In addition to our centralized location and our dedicated staff, you will appreciate our spacious studio suites with either a king bed or two queen beds. Additional amenities include: sofa bed, mini-fridge, microwave, in-room coffee service, a large well-lit desk, daily complimentary hot breakfast buffet, 24 hour fitness room, complimentary internet access, and much more.
